discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. External Subnets for External EPG / "For all subnets received by the L3Out, this option declares (selects) which of these subnets should be associated with this External EPG 
Once declared subnets are associated with this External EPG, the contracts applied to this External EPG then determine with which other EPGs the specified external subnet is allowed to communicate."

Shared Route Control Subnet - used to permit route leaking from the L3Out VRF to other VRF’s in the same or different tenants.If the declared subnet in the External EPG is in the L3Out VRF and has been learned from outside the fabric it can be leaked to the other VRFs where contracts exist.

Shared Security Import Subnet - This option applies the specified contract on the prefix within the VRF that has had the prefixed leaked\advertised into (leaking done by Shared Route Control Subnet).
If you want traffic to flow from one external EPG to another external EPG or from one external EPG to another internal EPG, the subnet must be marked with this control.

https://haystacknetworks.com/aci-l3out-subnet-options

choices.B:
External Subnets for External EPG

Shared Route Control Subnet -
Shared Security Import Subnet
choices.A:
External Subnets for External EPG

Import Route Control Subnet -
Shared Route Control Subnet
choices.C:
Export Route Control Subnet -

Shared Security Import Subnet -
Aggregate Shared Routes
choices.D:
Export Route Control Subnet -

Import Route Control Subnet -
Aggregate Shared Routes

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The external subnet and internal EPG1 must communicate with each other, and the L3Out traffic must leak into the VRF named “VF1”. Which configuration set accomplishes these goals?
What is the purpose of enabling ARP flooding when VMs are migrated from a pre-existing network to Cisco ACI and their gateways remain configured in the legacy setup?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The gateways are outside of ACI and VMs are inside of ACI. If ARP flooding is not enabled VMs are not going to be able to resolve the GW MAC when needed.
It's D, without ARP flooding the ACI Fabric would use HW Proxy for unknown destinations, so ARPs would never hit the DFGW in the legacy network.

Selected Answer: A
A. to avoid endpoint flapping between the legacy network and the ACI fabric
/ only A makes sense, other options relate to allowing/denying which are contracts

choices.A: to avoid endpoint flapping between the legacy network and the ACI fabric
choices.C: to allow communication between VMs and silent hosts
choices.B: to prevent VMs from communicating with physical servers within the ACI fabric
choices.D: to allow VMs to communicate with devices outside of their subnet

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A company decided to decrease its routing footprint and remove RT-2 and RT-3 devices from its data center. Because of that, the exit point must be created from all the tenants by using the common tenant. Which two configuration tasks must be completed to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Move subnets from all the bridge domains to the EPG level and mark them with flag Shared between VRFs.
choices.E: Export contract Ctr-2 into the tenant TN-1 and attach it as a consumer to all the EPGs in the tenant TN-1.
choices.B: Change contract Ctr-3 scope to Global, consume it by all EPGs, and flag all subnets with flag Shared between VRFs.
choices.D: Mark all subnets with flag Shared between VRFs and attach contract Ctr-3 as a provider to all the EPGs.
choices.C: Update the L3Out ExtEPG subnet in the common tenant with flag Shared Route Control Subnet and Aggregate Shared Routes.

discussion.content: A B Contract needs to be Global to be consumed by other Tenants

Selected Answer: AC
A. Move subnets from all the bridge domains to the EPG level and mark them with flag Shared between VRFs.

C. Update the L3Out ExtEPG subnet in the common tenant with flag Shared Route Control Subnet and Aggregate Shared Routes.

https://haystacknetworks.com/aci-l3out-subnet-options

Selected Answer: B
B. Apply Both Directions: Enabled -
Reverse Filter Ports: Enabled

if we want both direction, we should also reverse the ports, so both options to enabled, this is communication so both ways included, its not one way path

choices.C:
Apply Both Directions: Disabled -
Reverse Filter Ports: Disabled
choices.A:
Apply Both Directions: Disabled -
Reverse Filter Ports: Enabled
choices.B:
Apply Both Directions: Enabled -
Reverse Filter Ports: Enabled
choices.D:
Apply Both Directions: Enabled -
Reverse Filter Ports: Disabled

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which configuration set must be applied to filter 1 to enable SSH communication between Web_EPG to App_EPG?

discussion.content: D: Rogue EP Control: Detects endpoints that move frequently and disables endpoint learning for these endpoints only

questions.question_text: The engineer notices frequent MAC and IP address moves between different leaf switch ports. Which action prevents this problem from occurring?
